alert.note: Alert for St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 8:59PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following county, southeastern St. Lucie. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of roads, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Use extreme caution when driving at night, or avoid driving near this area altogether. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 854 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain, with flooding ongoing in the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. The St. Lucie County Sheriff`s Office has reported the closure of U.S. Highway 1 at the intersection of Riomar Drive. Other roads in the area are likely water covered. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... The greater Port Saint Lucie area, including nearby communities. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
